properties.description: K-ISMS-P establishes requirements for protecting personal data and securing information systems in South Korea. The framework establishes administrative, physical, and technical controls for data privacy and system security.

metadata.description: The source k8s object for constraint evaluation. 'Original' means only evaluate against the specific GroupVersionKind specified in the policy definition. 'Generated' means only evaluate against k8s objects generated by Gatekeeper ExpansionTemplates. 'All' means evaluate against both the original object and any generated ones.
Whether or not to return warnings back to the user in the kubectl cli

List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.
List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.
Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.
The list of capabilities that are allowed to be added to a container. Provide empty list as input to block everything.
The list of capabilities that must be dropped by a container.
The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identify is the name of container. Use an empty list to apply this policy to all containers in all namespaces.

The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identifier is the image of container. Prefix-matching can be signified with `*`. For example: `myregistry.azurecr.io/istio:*`. It is recommended that users use the fully-qualified Docker image name (e.g. start with a domain name) in order to avoid unexpectedly exempting images from an untrusted repository.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
The Maximum password age setting determines the period of time (in days) that a password can be used before the system requires the user to change it.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
The Minimum password length setting determines the least number of characters that can make up a password for a user account.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
The Enforce password history setting determines the number of unique new passwords that must be associated with a user account before an old password can be reused.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
The Minimum password age setting determines the period of time (in days) that a password must be used before the user can change it.
List of Azure Spring Cloud SKUs against which this policy will be evaluated.

metadata.displayName: Would you like to restrict specific IP addresses?
metadata.description: Select (Yes) to allow or forbid a list of IP addresses. If (No), the list of IP addresses won't have any effect in the policy enforcement
Array with allowed public IP addresses. An empty array is evaluated as to allow all IPs.
Array with forbidden public IP addresses. An empty array is evaluated as there are no forbidden IP addresses.
Resource Id of the virtual network. Example: /subscriptions/YourSubscriptionId/resourceGroups/YourResourceGroupName/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/Name

metadata.displayName: Storage Account Prefix for Regional Storage Account
metadata.description: This prefix will be combined with the network security group location to form the created storage account name.

metadata.displayName: Resource Group Name for Storage Account (must exist)
metadata.description: The resource group that the storage account will be created in. This resource group must already exist.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths
metadata.description: Specifies which registry paths will be accessible over the network, regardless of the users or groups listed in the access control list (ACL) of the `winreg` registry key.

metadata.displayName: Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths and sub-paths
metadata.description: Specifies which registry paths and sub-paths will be accessible over the network, regardless of the users or groups listed in the access control list (ACL) of the `winreg` registry key.

metadata.displayName: Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously
metadata.description: Specifies which network shares can be accessed by anonymous users. The default configuration for this policy setting has little effect because all users have to be authenticated before they can access shared resources on the server.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
Specifies whether the SMB client will allow insecure guest logons to an SMB server.

metadata.displayName: Allow simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows Domain
metadata.description: Specify whether to prevent computers from connecting to both a domain based network and a non-domain based network at the same time. A value of 0 allows simultaneous connections, and a value of 1 blocks them.
Specifies whether LLMNR, a secondary name resolution protocol that transmits using multicast over a local subnet link on a single subnet, is enabled.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: Network Security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos
metadata.description: Specifies the encryption types that Kerberos is allowed to use.

metadata.displayName: Network security: LAN Manager authentication level
metadata.description: Specify which challenge-response authentication protocol is used for network logons. This choice affects the level of authentication protocol used by clients, the level of session security negotiated, and the level of authentication accepted by servers.

metadata.displayName: Network security: LDAP client signing requirements
metadata.description: Specify the level of data signing that is requested on behalf of clients that issue LDAP BIND requests.

metadata.displayName: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients
metadata.description: Specifies which behaviors are allowed by clients for applications using the NTLM Security Support Provider (SSP). The SSP Interface (SSPI) is used by applications that need authentication services. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/security-policy-settings/network-security-minimum-session-security-for-ntlm-ssp-based-including-secure-rpc-servers for more information.

metadata.displayName: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers
metadata.description: Specifies which behaviors are allowed by servers for applications using the NTLM Security Support Provider (SSP). The SSP Interface (SSPI) is used by applications that need authentication services.
IPsec Encryption
IPsec Integrity
IKE Encryption
IKE Integrity
DH Group
PFS Group
Resource Id of the virtual network gateway. Example: /subscriptions/YourSubscriptionId/resourceGroups/YourResourceGroup/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworkGateways/Name

The resource ID of the virtual network subnet that should have a rule enabled. Example: /subscriptions/00000000-1111-2222-3333-444444444444/resourceGroups/Default/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/testvnet/subnets/testsubnet

The source k8s object for constraint evaluation. 'Original' means only evaluate against the specific GroupVersionKind specified in the policy definition. 'Generated' means only evaluate against k8s objects generated by Gatekeeper ExpansionTemplates. 'All' means evaluate against both the original object and any generated ones.
Whether or not to return warnings back to the user in the kubectl cli

List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.
List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.
Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.
Set this value to true if pod is allowed to use host network otherwise false.
The minimum value in the allowable host port range that pods can use in the host network namespace.
The maximum value in the allowable host port range that pods can use in the host network namespace.
The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identify is the name of container. Use an empty list to apply this policy to all containers in all namespaces.

The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identifier is the image of container. Prefix-matching can be signified with `*`. For example: `myregistry.azurecr.io/istio:*`. It is recommended that users use the fully-qualified Docker image name (e.g. start with a domain name) in order to avoid unexpectedly exempting images from an untrusted repository.

metadata.displayName: Subnet to use for Private Endpoints
metadata.description: The name of the subnet within the virtual network that you would like to use for your Private Endpoint Connection deployment

All disks in this region are validated and disk access resource would be associated with them.

metadata.displayName: Resource Id for the DiskAccess in the given location to which the disk resource needs to be linked
metadata.description: Disk access resources enable exporting managed disks securely via private endpoints. Learn more at: https://aka.ms/disksprivatelinksdoc
The list of excluded API kinds for customer-managed key, default is the list of API kinds that don't have data stored in Cognitive Services
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
The minimum TLS protocol version that should be enabled. Windows machines with lower TLS versions will be marked as non-compliant.
Minimum version of TLS required to access data in this storage account
The list of SKUs that support customer-managed key encryption key

metadata.displayName: Double encryption should be enabled on Recovery Services vaults for Backup
metadata.description: Check if double encryption is enabled on Recovery Services vaults for Backup.  For more details refer to https://aka.ms/AB-InfraEncryption.
The list of SKUs that support software-based double encryption
The list of allowed disk encryption sets for managed disks.
The maximum number of days after key creation until it must be rotated.
The list of allowed key types
The minimum key size for RSA keys.
The list of allowed curve names for elliptic curve cryptography certificates.

The required resource logs retention in days

This Policy will review Vnets only in the selected region. You can create other assignments to include other regions.
The resource id of storage account where flowlogs will be sent to. It will be used for deployment purposes only. Make sure this storage account is located in the same region as the Vnet.
The name of the resource group where the flowLog resources will be created. This will be used only if a deployment is required. This is the resource group where the Network Watchers are located.
The resource id of the network watcher under which the flowLog resources will be created. Make sure it belongs to the same region as the Vnet.

metadata.displayName: Number of days to retain flowlogs
metadata.description: The number of days for which flowlog data will be retained in storage account. If you want to retain data forever and do not want to apply any retention policy, set retention (days) to 0.
The required resource logs retention in days
The required resource logs retention in days if exporting to an Azure Storage account
The required resource logs retention in days if exporting to an Azure Storage account
Audit if Network Watcher is not enabled for region(s).
Name of the resource group of NetworkWatcher, such as NetworkWatcherRG. This is the resource group where the Network Watchers are located.
Policy Operation name for which activity log alert should exist
Administrative Operation name for which activity log alert should be configured
The required resource logs retention in days

Auto provision the Log Analytics agent on your subscriptions to monitor and collect security data using a custom workspace.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
A semicolon-separated list of the workspace IDs that the Log Analytics agent should be connected to
The diagnostic settings profile name

Select Log Analytics workspace from dropdown list. If this workspace is outside of the scope of the assignment you must manually grant 'Log Analytics Contributor' permissions (or similar) to the policy assignment's principal ID.
Whether to enable metrics stream to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False
Whether to enable logs stream to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: Location (Specify the location of the VMs that you want to protect)
metadata.description: Specify the location of the VMs that you want to protect. VMs should be backed up to a vault in the same location. For example - southeastasia.

metadata.displayName: Backup Policy (of type Azure VM from a vault in the location chosen above)
metadata.description: Specify the id of the Azure backup policy to configure backup of the virtual machines. The selected Azure backup policy should be of type Azure virtual machine. This policy needs to be in a vault that is present in the location chosen above. For example - /subscriptions/<SubscriptionId>/resourceGroups/<resourceGroupName>/providers/Microsoft.RecoveryServices/vaults/<VaultName>/backupPolicies/<BackupPolicyName>.
Name of the tag to use for excluding VMs from the scope of this policy. This should be used along with the Exclusion Tag Value parameter. Learn more at https://aka.ms/AppCentricVMBackupPolicy.

Value of the tag to use for excluding VMs from the scope of this policy (in case of multiple values, use a comma-separated list). This should be used along with the Exclusion Tag Name parameter. Learn more at https://aka.ms/AppCentricVMBackupPolicy.
Mode required for all WAF policies
Mode required for all WAF policies

The source k8s object for constraint evaluation. 'Original' means only evaluate against the specific GroupVersionKind specified in the policy definition. 'Generated' means only evaluate against k8s objects generated by Gatekeeper ExpansionTemplates. 'All' means evaluate against both the original object and any generated ones.
Whether or not to return warnings back to the user in the kubectl cli

List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.
List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.
Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.
The maximum CPU units allowed for a container. E.g. 200m. For more information, please refer https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits
The maximum memory bytes allowed for a container. E.g. 1Gi. For more information, please refer https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits
The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identify is the name of container. Use an empty list to apply this policy to all containers in all namespaces.

The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identifier is the image of container. Prefix-matching can be signified with `*`. For example: `myregistry.azurecr.io/istio:*`. It is recommended that users use the fully-qualified Docker image name (e.g. start with a domain name) in order to avoid unexpectedly exempting images from an untrusted repository.

List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.
Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

The 'RunAsUser' rule that containers are allowed to run with. MustRunAs requires at least one range to be specified. MustRunAsNonRoot requires the pod be submitted with non-zero runAsUser or have USER directive defined (using a numeric UID) in the image. RunAsAny allows any runAsUser to be specified
The user ID ranges that are allowed for containers to use. Set 'max' as '-1' to skip max limit evaluation. Empty array blocks every defined value for 'MustRunAs'.
The 'RunAsGroup' rule that containers are allowed to run with. MustRunAs requires at least one range to be specified. MayRunAs does not require that 'RunAsGroup' be specified. RunAsAny allows any
The group ID ranges that are allowed for containers to use. Set 'max' as '-1' to skip max limit evaluation. Empty array blocks every defined value for 'MustRunAs' and 'MayRunAs'.

The 'SupplementalGroups' rule that containers are allowed to run with. MustRunAs requires at least one range to be specified. MayRunAs does not require that 'SupplementalGroups' be specified. RunAsAny allows any
The supplemental group ID ranges that are allowed for containers to use. Set 'max' as '-1' to skip max limit evaluation. Empty array blocks every defined value for 'MustRunAs' and 'MayRunAs'.
The 'FSGroup' rule that containers are allowed to run with. MustRunAs requires at least one range to be specified. MayRunAs does not require that 'FSGroup' be specified. RunAsAny allows any

metadata.displayName: Allowed file system group ID ranges
metadata.description: The file system group ranges that are allowed for pods to use. Set 'max' as '-1' to skip max limit evaluation. Empty array blocks every defined value for 'MustRunAs' and 'MayRunAs'.
The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identify is the name of container. Use an empty list to apply this policy to all containers in all namespaces.

The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identifier is the image of container. Prefix-matching can be signified with `*`. For example: `myregistry.azurecr.io/istio:*`. It is recommended that users use the fully-qualified Docker image name (e.g. start with a domain name) in order to avoid unexpectedly exempting images from an untrusted repository.

The source k8s object for constraint evaluation. 'Original' means only evaluate against the specific GroupVersionKind specified in the policy definition. 'Generated' means only evaluate against k8s objects generated by Gatekeeper ExpansionTemplates. 'All' means evaluate against both the original object and any generated ones.
Whether or not to return warnings back to the user in the kubectl cli

List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.
List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.
Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

metadata.displayName: Status if Windows Defender is not available on machine
metadata.description: Windows Defender Exploit Guard is only available starting with Windows 10/Windows Server with update 1709. Setting this value to 'Non-Compliant' shows machines with older versions on which Windows Defender Exploit Guard is not available (such as Windows Server 2012 R2) as non-compliant. Setting this value to 'Compliant' shows these machines as compliant.
The limit to how long a certificate may be valid for. Certificates with lengthy validity periods aren't best practice.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Admin Approval Mode for the Built-in Administrator account
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of Admin Approval Mode for the built-in Administrator account.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Detect application installations and prompt for elevation
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of application installation detection for the computer.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of all User Account Control (UAC) policy settings for the computer.

metadata.displayName: Recovery console: Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and all folders
metadata.description: Specifies whether to make the Recovery Console SET command available, which allows setting of recovery console environment variables.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

A semicolon-separated list of the names of the applications that should be installed. e.g. 'Microsoft SQL Server 2014 (64-bit); Microsoft Visual Studio Code' or 'Microsoft SQL Server 2014*' (to match any application starting with 'Microsoft SQL Server 2014')
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

The path to the certificate store containing the certificates to check the expiration dates of. Default value is 'Cert:' which is the root certificate store path, so all certificates on the machine will be checked. Other example paths: 'Cert:\LocalMachine', 'Cert:\LocalMachine\TrustedPublisher', 'Cert:\CurrentUser'

An integer indicating the number of days within which to check for certificates that are expiring. For example, if this value is 30, any certificate expiring within the next 30 days will cause this policy to be non-compliant.

A semicolon-separated list of certificate thumbprints to check under the specified path. If a value is not specified, all certificates under the certificate store path will be checked. If a value is specified, no certificates other than those with the thumbprints specified will be checked. e.g. THUMBPRINT1;THUMBPRINT2;THUMBPRINT3
A semicolon-separated list of certificate thumbprints to ignore. e.g. THUMBPRINT1;THUMBPRINT2;THUMBPRINT3

Must be 'true' or 'false'. True indicates that any found certificates that have already expired will also make this policy non-compliant. False indicates that certificates that have expired will be be ignored.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
The list of allowed certificate key types.
The minimum key size for RSA certificates.
The list of allowed curve names for elliptic curve cryptography certificates.

metadata.displayName: Allowed Azure Key Vault Supported CAs
metadata.description: The list of allowed certificate authorities supported by Azure Key Vault.

The source k8s object for constraint evaluation. 'Original' means only evaluate against the specific GroupVersionKind specified in the policy definition. 'Generated' means only evaluate against k8s objects generated by Gatekeeper ExpansionTemplates. 'All' means evaluate against both the original object and any generated ones.
Whether or not to return warnings back to the user in the kubectl cli

List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. Providing a value for this parameter is optional. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.
List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.
Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.
List of External IPs that services are allowed to use. Empty array means all external IPs are disallowed.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
Specifies limits on password reuse - how many times a new password must be created for a user account before the password can be repeated.
Specifies the maximum number of days that may elapse before a user account password must be changed. The format of the value is two integers separated by a comma, denoting an inclusive range.
Specifies the minimum number of days that must elapse before a user account password can be changed.
Specifies the minimum number of characters that a user account password may contain.

Specifies whether a user account password must be complex. If required, a complex password must not contain part of  user's account name or full name; be at least 6 characters long; contain a mix of uppercase, lowercase, number, and non-alphabetic characters.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

Specifies whether audit events are generated when changes are made to authentication policy. This setting is useful for tracking changes in domain-level and forest-level trust and privileges that are granted to user accounts or groups.

Specifies whether audit events are generated for assignment and removal of user rights in user right policies, changes in security token object permission, resource attributes changes and Central Access Policy changes for file system objects.
